parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Nominative 2nd Person Plural
str2: You. The person pronoun of the second person singular; thou.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 2nd Person Plural
str2: I am, exist. The first person singular present indicative; a prolonged form of a primary and defective verb; I exist.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive 1st Person Plural
str2: I, the first-person pronoun. A primary pronoun of the first person I.
A letter, dispatch, epistle, message. From epistello; a written message.

parse: Verb - Perfect Participle Middle or Passive - Nominative Feminine Singular
str2: To write, inscribe. From en and grapho; to 'engrave', i.e. Inscribe.
In, on, among. A primary preposition denoting position, and instrumentality, i.e. A relation of rest; 'in, ' at, on, by, etc.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive 1st Person Plural
str2: I, the first-person pronoun. A primary pronoun of the first person I.
Prolonged from a primary kar; the heart, i.e. the thoughts or feelings; also the middle.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Middle or Passive - Nominative Feminine Singular
str2: A prolonged form of a primary verb; to 'know' in a great variety of applications and with many implications.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Middle or Passive - Nominative Feminine Singular
str2: To read, know again, know certainly, recognize, discern. From ana and ginosko; to know again, i.e. to read.
A primary preposition; under, i.e. of place, or with verbs; of place (underneath) or where (below) or time (when).
All, the whole, every kind of. Including all the forms of declension; apparently a primary word; all, any, every, the whole.
